00070 /**************************************************************************/
00079 EMSTATUS PAL_SpiInit (void)
00080 {
00081   EMSTATUS                status    = PAL_EMSTATUS_OK;
00082   USART_InitSync_TypeDef  usartInit = USART_INITSYNC_DEFAULT;
00083 
00084   /* Initialize USART for SPI transaction */
00085   CMU_ClockEnable( PAL_SPI_USART_CLOCK, true );
00086   usartInit.baudrate = PAL_SPI_BAUDRATE;
00087   usartInit.databits = usartDatabits16;
00088   
00089   USART_InitSync( PAL_SPI_USART_UNIT, &usartInit );
00090   PAL_SPI_USART_UNIT->ROUTE = (USART_ROUTE_CLKPEN | USART_ROUTE_TXPEN | PAL_SPI_USART_LOCATION);
00091 
00092   return status;
00093 }
00094

00096 /**************************************************************************/
00104 EMSTATUS PAL_SpiShutdown (void)
00105 {
00106   EMSTATUS status = PAL_EMSTATUS_OK;
00107 
00108   /* Disable the USART device used for SPI. */
00109   USART_Enable( PAL_SPI_USART_UNIT, usartDisable);
00110 
00111   /* Disable the USART clock. */
00112   CMU_ClockEnable( PAL_SPI_USART_CLOCK, false );
00113 
00114   return status;
00115 }

00118 /**************************************************************************/
00126 EMSTATUS PAL_SpiTransmit (uint8_t* data, unsigned int len)
00127 {
00128   EMSTATUS status = PAL_EMSTATUS_OK;
00129 
00130   while (len>1)
00131   {
00132     /* Send only one byte if len==1 or data pointer is not aligned at a 16 bit
00133        word location in memory. */
00134     if ((len == 1) || ((unsigned int)data & 0x1))
00135     {
00136       USART_Tx( PAL_SPI_USART_UNIT, *(uint8_t*)data );
00137       len  --;
00138       data ++;
00139     }
00140     else
00141     {
00142       USART_TxDouble( PAL_SPI_USART_UNIT, *(uint16_t*)data );
00143       len  -= 2;
00144       data += 2;
00145     }
00146   }
00147 
00148   /* Wait for transfer to finish */
00149   while (!(PAL_SPI_USART_UNIT->STATUS & USART_STATUS_TXC)) ;
00150 
00151   return status;
00152 }

00163 EMSTATUS PAL_TimerInit (void)
00164 {
00165   EMSTATUS status = PAL_EMSTATUS_OK;
00166 
00167   UDELAY_Calibrate();
00168 
00169   return status;

00173 /**************************************************************************/
00181 EMSTATUS PAL_TimerShutdown (void)
00182 {
00183   EMSTATUS status = PAL_EMSTATUS_OK;
00184 
00185   /* Nothing to do since the UDELAY_Delay does not use any resources after
00186      the UDELAY_Calibrate has been called. The UDELAY_Calibrate uses the
00187      RTC to calibrate the delay loop, and restores the RTC after use. */
00188 
00189   return status;
00190 }
00191

00200 EMSTATUS PAL_TimerMicroSecondsDelay(unsigned int usecs)
00201 {
00202   EMSTATUS status = PAL_EMSTATUS_OK;
00203 
00204   UDELAY_Delay(usecs);
00205 
00206   return status;
00207 }

00221 EMSTATUS PAL_TimerRepeat (void(*pFunction)(void*),
00222                             void* argument,
00223                             unsigned int frequency)
00224 {
00225   if (0 != PAL_TIMER_REPEAT_FUNCTION(pFunction, argument, frequency))
00226     return PAL_EMSTATUS_REPEAT_FAILED;
00227   else
00228     return EMSTATUS_OK;
00229 }

00271 /***************************************************************************/
00290 EMSTATUS PAL_GpioPinModeSet(unsigned int   port,
00291                             unsigned int   pin,
00292                             PAL_GpioMode_t mode,
00293                             unsigned int   platformSpecific)
00294 {
00295   EMSTATUS status = PAL_EMSTATUS_OK;
00296   GPIO_Mode_TypeDef   emGpioMode;
00297 
00298   /* Convert PAL pin mode to GPIO_Mode_TypeDef defined in em_gpio.h.  */
00299   switch (mode)
00300   {
00301   case palGpioModePushPull:
00302     emGpioMode = gpioModePushPull;
00303     break;
00304   default:
00305     return PAL_EMSTATUS_INVALID_PARAM;
00306   }
00307 
00308   GPIO_PinModeSet((GPIO_Port_TypeDef) port, pin, emGpioMode, platformSpecific);
00309 
00310   return status;
00311 }
00312

00389 #ifdef INCLUDE_PAL_GPIO_PIN_AUTO_TOGGLE
00390 /**************************************************************************/
00398 EMSTATUS PAL_GpioPinAutoToggle (unsigned int gpioPort,
00399                                 unsigned int gpioPin,
00400                                 unsigned int frequency)
00401 {
00402   EMSTATUS status = EMSTATUS_OK;
00403 
00404   /* Store GPIO pin data. */
00405   gpioPortNo = gpioPort;
00406   gpioPinNo  = gpioPin;
00407 
00408   /* Setup GPIO pin. */
00409   GPIO_PinModeSet((GPIO_Port_TypeDef)gpioPort, gpioPin, gpioModePushPull, 0 );
00410 
00411   /* Setup RTC to generate interrupts at given frequency. */
00412   rtcSetup(frequency);
00413      
00414   return status;
00415 }
00416 
00417 
00418 /**************************************************************************/
00423 void RTC_IRQHandler(void)
00424 {
00425   /* Clear interrupt source */
00426   RTC_IntClear(RTC_IF_COMP0);
00427 
00428   /* Toggle GPIO pin. */
00429   GPIO_PinOutToggle((GPIO_Port_TypeDef)gpioPortNo, gpioPinNo );
00430 }
00431 
00432 
00433 /**************************************************************************/
00437 static void rtcSetup(unsigned int frequency)
00438 {
00439   RTC_Init_TypeDef rtcInit = RTC_INIT_DEFAULT;
00440 
00441   /* Enable LE domain registers */
00442   if ( !( CMU->HFCORECLKEN0 & CMU_HFCORECLKEN0_LE) )
00443   {
00444     CMU_ClockEnable(cmuClock_CORELE, true);
00445   }
00446 
00447 #ifdef PAL_RTC_CLOCK_LFXO
00448   /* LFA with LFXO setup is relatively time consuming. Therefore, check if it
00449      already enabled before calling. */
00450   if ( !(CMU->STATUS & CMU_STATUS_LFXOENS) )
00451   {
00452     CMU_OscillatorEnable(cmuOsc_LFXO, true, true);
00453   }
00454   if ( cmuSelect_LFXO != CMU_ClockSelectGet(cmuClock_LFA) )
00455   {
00456     CMU_ClockSelectSet(cmuClock_LFA, cmuSelect_LFXO);
00457   }
00458 #elif defined PAL_RTC_CLOCK_LFRCO
00459   /* Enable LFACLK in CMU (will also enable LFRCO oscillator if not enabled) */
00460   CMU_ClockSelectSet(cmuClock_LFA, cmuSelect_LFRCO);
00461 #elif defined PAL_RTC_CLOCK_ULFRCO
00462   /* Enable LFACLK in CMU (will also enable ULFRCO oscillator if not enabled) */
00463   CMU_ClockSelectSet(cmuClock_LFA, cmuSelect_ULFRCO);
00464 #else
00465 #error No clock source for RTC defined.
00466 #endif
00467 
00468   /* Set the prescaler. */
00469   CMU_ClockDivSet( cmuClock_RTC, cmuClkDiv_1 );
00470 
00471   /* Enable RTC clock */
00472   CMU_ClockEnable(cmuClock_RTC, true);
00473 
00474   /* Initialize RTC */
00475   rtcInit.enable   = false;  /* Do not start RTC after initialization is complete. */
00476   rtcInit.debugRun = false;  /* Halt RTC when debugging. */
00477   rtcInit.comp0Top = true;   /* Wrap around on COMP0 match. */
00478   RTC_Init(&rtcInit);
00479 
00480   /* Interrupt at given frequency. */
00481   RTC_CompareSet(0, (CMU_ClockFreqGet(cmuClock_RTC) / frequency) - 1 );
00482 
00483   /* Enable interrupt */
00484   NVIC_EnableIRQ(RTC_IRQn);
00485   RTC_IntEnable(RTC_IEN_COMP0);
00486 
00487   /* Start Counter */
00488   RTC_Enable(true);
00489 }
00490 #endif  /* INCLUDE_PAL_GPIO_PIN_AUTO_TOGGLE */
